title: How many grams of CuO would be required to produce 30.0 moles of nitrogen gas in the following chemical reaction? 2 NH₃(g) + 3 CuO(s) → 3 Cu(s) + N₂(g) + 3 H₂O(g) - Quora

response.answer_text: From the balanced equation: 3 mol CuO will react to produce 1 mol N2 To produce 30 mol N2 you must react 3*30 = 90 mol CuO Molar mass CuO = 79.55 g/mol Mass of 90 mol CuO = 90 mol * 79.55 g/mol = 7,159.5 g CuO required
You will need 30 x 3 moles of CuO. The molar mass of CuO is (63.5 + 16) grams. Now, you have the information to calculate your answer.
